lexUnit.name: stare.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fixed look at someone or something with the eyes wide open

sentence.text: I go and sit on the bench in front of the Christmas tree and stare at it .
'Tis a wild wolves ' moon that stares at me
I hold my shivering knees and stare at the shadows on the walls .
He rolls up a dollar bill , and stares at it as if deliberately recalling something .
The neat young businessman stares at me .
Once out of Kathmandu we started getting long stares from villagers , laying out spring wheat on the road to be threshed by passing cars and carts .
She now turned her smile on Millie , but she received no answering smile , only a stare from what she thought were those very odd grey eyes .
Heidi was suddenly conscious of the stares from passing strangers .
Benny shouted , drawing startled stares from some Marines .
Polly 's cheeks grew warm , then hot , as she became aware of frankly appraising stares from both men and women .
Her friendly enquiry as to the whereabouts of the Red House was met by a hostile stare from the woman behind the counter .
The person sitting on the low wall did not move , even when Pol cast a meaningful stare in its direction .
She places her hands on my cheeks and stares into my eyes .
He seemed oblivious of the stares of the whole town .
She suddenly knew how a rabbit felt under the hypnotic stare of the hawk .
He turned a brief cold stare on her .
He fixed his stare on a shelduck whose white and brown plumage he could easily see .
The pony poked his head out of the half-door and fixed a sullen stare on his mistress .
Beside her , a fluffy foal stares stridently at us .
Their eyes met in a long , arching stare .
The woman took the cups , gave the figure on the bed a dispassionate stare .
